Jargon Term: suffered a stroke in the left part of your brain that is involved in understanding and producing language
soft plaque in the left carotid
bleeding from the squamous cell carcinoma on your right foot
Annotation: Medical Issues - Complication developed in the hospital

Jargon Term: Given that you have had trouble with bleeding from the squamous cell carcinoma on your right foot, we spoke with your outpatient dermatologist, the plastic surgery consult team, and the radiation oncology consult service about this. The only possible noninvasive option to help with this would be 15-20 sessions with the radiation oncologists to help stop the bleeding. After discussion with your family, it is thought that returning for these sessions would be too disruptive to complete.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: Therefore we will hold off on full blood thinners
Please continue to take aspirin 325mg by mouth daily to help prevent future strokes
We also started a medication, simvastatin 40mg by mouth daily. This is to decrease inflammation and to help decrease your risk for future strokes.
